revised_title: Experimental Induction of Melanism in Selenia biiunaria: Inheritance and Effects of Manganese Chloride
tldr: The author conducted experiments to induce melanism in the Lepidopterous insect, Selenia biiunaria, by feeding larvae on foliage sprayed with manganese chloride. The results showed that the treated insects had a higher proportion of melanistic individuals, suggesting that manganese chloride played a role in the induction of melanism. Further breeding experiments confirmed the inheritance of melanism in the treated insects.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Insect Biology
